Ask HN: Who wants to be fired (February 2023)
text:
Whilst this is a bit humorous entry I wonder how many of us would consider quitting their current jobs and why? (throwaway accounts welcome)

As we are heading into longer term recession after a fantastic decade in tech world, post covid and tired, and just ahead of more and more serious climate change effects, do you have thoughts like “I have earned enough”?

What are your plans?

title: Show HN: Go Feature Flag OSS self-hosted feature flag solution launch v1.0.0
text:
Hey Hackernews! I am the creator and maintainer of GO Feature Flag, a self-hosted OpenSource solution for feature flags (or feature toggles) that requires almost no infrastructure. We store all our flag in a flat file somewhere (S3, github, ...) and we use it directly.

Today we have finally released the version v1.0.0 that brings a new flag format that enable you to do even more with your feature flags.

The solution offer some capabilities such as: - Targeting specific users - Fancy rollout capabilities (progressive rollout, A/B testing, scheduled rollout). - Exporting your usage in several location. - Compatibility with the new standard Open Feature.

All feedback are welcome .

Github: https://github.com/thomaspoignant/go-feature-flag

v1.0.0 blog post: https://gofeatureflag.org/blog/2023/02/01/introducing-v1.0.0

Ask HN: How does one introduce a 'bill' or an 'act'
text:
I want to understand how to introduce a bill or an act.

The bill/act I want to introduce is a simple one ;

"Police officers must earn a certain amount of tenure and training before being issued a gun"

Full stop.

-

The police academy should focus on understanding law.

But it should take years for a police officer to earn their gun carrying ability.

CMV.

Ask HN: PayPal not allowing friends/family payments?
text:
It used to be easy to send money via PayPal and mark it as "friends/family" instead of "payment for services". The latter comes with purchase protections, and PayPal takes a cut. But now it seems that when people send money to my startup, even as a donation (we make tools that help students with dyslexia read more easily, so some people just want to help us out), PayPal takes a fee every time.

Is this PayPal's new normal? If so, what other platforms to folks recommend for one-off donation type payments?
